Bryxcel Homes Ltd is a distinguished real estate and hospitality brand headquartered in Abuja, Nigeria. Established with a vision to redefine living standards and hospitality experiences, we specialize in a comprehensive range of services including property development, sales, rentals, property management, and short-term apartment leasing for Bed and Breakfast (BnB) accommodations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Executive

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are seeking a proactive and results-driven Business Development Executive with proven marketing expertise in real estate or hospitality.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for driving revenue growth through client acquisition, market penetration, and relationship management.
	The role requires a strategic thinker with a strong background in marketing and demonstrated success in achieving sales and business expansion targets.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify, develop, and execute business opportunities to increase sales and occupancy rates.
	Conduct market research to identify new clients, trends, and business opportunities.
	Develop and implement innovative marketing strategies to promote real estate or hospitality offerings.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, corporate partners, and investors.
	Prepare and deliver persuasive business proposals and presentations to prospective clients.
	Drive lead generation through digital platforms, referrals, networking, and industry events.
	Track and analyze performance metrics to evaluate business growth initiatives.
	Collaborate with operations, sales, and marketing teams to ensure seamless client engagement.
	Negotiate and close business deals while ensuring client satisfaction and repeat patronage.
	Prepare weekly and monthly reports on business development performance.


Requirements &amp; Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or related discipline.
	Minimum of 3 years of proven marketing experience in real estate or hospitality (candidates must provide verifiable track records and portfolio/proof of achievements).
	Strong knowledge of real estate/hospitality market dynamics, customer preferences, and competitor activities.
	Demonstrated ability to meet or exceed revenue and growth targets.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
	Proficiency in digital marketing, CRM tools, and MS Office applications.
	Strong interpersonal skills with a client-centric mindset.
	Self-motivated, result-oriented, and capable of working independently with minimal supervision.


Preferred Attributes:


	Established network of clients and industry contacts in real estate or hospitality.
	Certification(s) in Sales, Marketing, or Business Development (an advantage).
	Ability to think critically and provide creative solutions to business challenges


Salary
N100,000 - N120,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and motivation letter to:&nbsp;info@bryxcel.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

        Bryxcel Homes Limited is a distinguished real estate and hospitality brand headquartered in Abuja, Nigeria. Established with a vision to redefine living standards and hospitality experiences, we specialize in a comprehensive range of services including property development, sales, rentals, property management, and short-term apartment leasing for Bed and Breakfast (BnB) accommodations. Bryxcel Homes Ltd is a distinguished real estate and hospitality brand headquartered in Abuja, Nigeria. Established with a vision to redefine living standards and hospitality experiences, we specialize in a comprehensive range of services including property development, sales, rentals, property management, and short-term apartment leasing for Bed and Breakfast (BnB) accommodations.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Executive

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are seeking a proactive and results-driven Business Development Executive with proven marketing expertise in real estate or hospitality.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for driving revenue growth through client acquisition, market penetration, and relationship management.
	The role requires a strategic thinker with a strong background in marketing and demonstrated success in achieving sales and business expansion targets.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify, develop, and execute business opportunities to increase sales and occupancy rates.
	Conduct market research to identify new clients, trends, and business opportunities.
	Develop and implement innovative marketing strategies to promote real estate or hospitality offerings.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, corporate partners, and investors.
	Prepare and deliver persuasive business proposals and presentations to prospective clients.
	Drive lead generation through digital platforms, referrals, networking, and industry events.
	Track and analyze performance metrics to evaluate business growth initiatives.
	Collaborate with operations, sales, and marketing teams to ensure seamless client engagement.
	Negotiate and close business deals while ensuring client satisfaction and repeat patronage.
	Prepare weekly and monthly reports on business development performance.


Requirements & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or related discipline.
	Minimum of 3 years of proven marketing experience in real estate or hospitality (candidates must provide verifiable track records and portfolio/proof of achievements).
	Strong knowledge of real estate/hospitality market dynamics, customer preferences, and competitor activities.
	Demonstrated ability to meet or exceed revenue and growth targets.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
	Proficiency in digital marketing, CRM tools, and MS Office applications.
	Strong interpersonal skills with a client-centric mindset.
	Self-motivated, result-oriented, and capable of working independently with minimal supervision.


Preferred Attributes:


	Established network of clients and industry contacts in real estate or hospitality.
	Certification(s) in Sales, Marketing, or Business Development (an advantage).
	Ability to think critically and provide creative solutions to business challenges


Salary
N100,000 - N120,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and motivation letter to: info@bryxcel.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Social Media Manager Job at Biz Afric Solutions




        
    

        
        Biz Afric Solutions - Our client is a fast growing Hair Brand known for Quality Human Hair Weaves, Hair Accessories and crafting exquisite custom braided wigs for trendy, beautiful and elegant women worldwide. They offer premium human hair extensions and handcrafted braided wigs designed to elevate your look and boost your confidence.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager

Job Location: Remote
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview
     

            
    




	We are looking for a creative and strategic Social Media Manager to join our team.
	The ideal candidate is not just skilled in content creation and social media management, but also has a background or passion for hairstyling/wigs, ensuring our brand content is both authentic and engaging.


Responsibilities


	Develop and execute social media strategies to grow brand presence across our social platforms .
	Create engaging content (images, videos, reels, stories, product showcases).
	Stay up to date with trends in the hair/beauty industry and apply them creatively.
	Run and monitor ad campaigns for engagement and sales.
	Track analytics and prepare weekly reports.
	Collaborate with hairstylists, influencers, and content creators to produce engaging campaign
	Manage social media calendars, ensuring timely posting and consistent brand voice.
	Monitor, track, and report on performance metrics, optimizing strategies for reach, engagement, and conversions.
	Respond to comments, DMs, and community interactions in a timely and brand-aligned manner.
	Plan and execute paid ad campaigns in collaboration with the marketing team.
	Brainstorm and launch creative campaigns, product launches, tutorials, and behind-the-scenes content.


Requirements


	Proven experience as a Social Media Manager or similar role, preferably in the beauty, fashion, or lifestyle industry.
	Strong passion for hairstyling, wigs, and beauty culture.
	Proficiency in content creation, video editing, and social media tools (Canva, CapCut, Adobe Suite, etc.).
	Deep understanding of social media trends, algorithms, and analytics.
	Excellent communication skills with a knack for storytelling and community engagement.
	Ability to work independently, manage multiple platforms, and meet deadlines.
	Familiarity with influencer partnerships and paid social campaigns is a plus.


Note: Female Applicants are preferable.

Operations Officer Job at Small Mammal Conservation Organization (SMACON)




        
    

        
        Small Mammal Conservation Organization (SMACON) is a non-governmental organization committed to the protection of small mammals and their habitat through evidence-based conservation that safeguards local livelihoods. We work with local, regional and international partners to deploy SMACON's mission. We are looking for passionate individuals who are dedicated to the documentation and protection of biodiversity in Nigeria, the Gulf of Guinea Islands, and supporting our network of partners across West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Officer

Job Location: Calabar, Cross River
Job type: Full-time
Reports to: Chief Operations Office
     

            
    



Job Description and Responsibilities
Administrative Support:


	Manage daily office operations and procedures.
	Assist in planning events and workshops - coordinate transportation, flight scheduling, and accommodation during such events.
	Schedule and coordinate staff reviews.
	Oversee maintenance of office facilities, equipment, and supplies, and the tracking of SMACON assets.


Financial and Budgetary Support:


	Assist in preparing operational budgets and tracking expenditures on specific projects.
	Maintain records for audits and internal reviews.
	Support in grant writing and reporting.


Program Operations Support:


	Work closely with program teams to support field operations.
	Coordinate with field staff for activity reports and operational needs.
	Liaise with other departments for their operational needs.


Qualifications and Experience


	Candidates should possess a B.Sc/BA/HND, preferably in Science or related disciplines.
	Proper business English, punctuation, spelling, and grammatical usage.
	Ability to lead a team.
	Dynamic and able to quickly learn new skills.


Salary
N300,000 - N400,000 / Month (depending on level of experience).

Note


	Candidates will be required to upload a copy of your cover letter and CV. Ensure that both files are merged into a single pdf file.
	Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis, and only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Ikeja Electric Distribution Company (IKEDC) is one of the largest power distribution companies in Nigeria, committed to delivering reliable and efficient electricity services to our customers. With a strong focus on innovation and sustainability, we aim to transform the energy landscape in Nigeria and contribute to the country's economic development. Our mission is to provide exceptional service while ensuring the safety and well being of our employees and customers At Ikeja Electric, we don’t just power homes and businesses we power careers As a leading energy provider, we are committed to fostering a culture that champions integrity, innovation, and excellence. Our team is the heartbeat of our success, and we thrive on collaboration, continuous improvement, and creating a workplace where everyone can shine.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Internal Control Officer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Purpose


	Will be responsible for carrying out day-to-day internal control monitoring and process enforcement activities in the assigned areas of the company.


Role Accountabilities


	Implement the requirements of the internal control framework, charter, and manual relating to the assigned coverage areas.
	Comply fully with the internal control manual and process requirements.
	Contribute to the development and regular updating of the internal control manual.
	Contribute to the development of the internal control monitoring and enforcement processes and procedures that guide the operation of the internal control system.
	Routinely confirm compliance with policies, processes, procedures and other controls within the area of coverage and provide exception reports on a regular basis.
	Follow up to ensure that the observed or escalated exceptions are regularized within reasonable timeframe.
	Ensure that deliberate noncompliance with key policies, processes, procedures or other controls is escalated in appropriate format for disciplinary action.
	Through routine reviews, identify process, policy and procedural gaps in the areas of overage and make appropriate recommendations to strengthen the system.
	Carry out special reviews directed by Management within the stipulated timeline.

	Conduct assigned ad hoc investigations into incidents, complaints, and procedural breaches and provide high quality report within the stipulated timeframe.

Minimum Requirements


	A First degree or equivalent in science or social science field.

  "title": "Procurement Officer",
  "description": "Nestoil Plc was incorporated in Nigeria in 1991 for the provision of Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) services to the energy and oil &amp; gas industry. Since then, Nestoil has grown to become the leading indigenous EPC provider for major IOCs (International Oil Companies) in Sub-Saharan Africa like National Petroleum Company (NNPC) Shell, Exxon Mobil, Chevron, Total, etc.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer

Job Locations:&nbsp;Warri, Delta

Job&nbsp;Description


	The Procurement Officer will be responsible for the efficient sourcing, purchasing, and management of materials, equipment, and services required for drilling operations.
	The role ensures that procurement activities are cost-effective, timely, compliant with company policies, and aligned with local and international regulatory standards in the oil &amp; gas industry.


Responsibilities
As a Procurement Officer, your responsibilities will be:


	Source, evaluate, and negotiate with approved vendors, suppliers, and contractors.
	Prepare and issue purchase orders (POs) in line with drilling operational needs.
	Ensure procurement of drilling consumables, spare parts, tools, equipment, and support services.
	Maintain an updated vendor database, ensuring suppliers meet quality, HSE, and compliance requirements.
	Conduct vendor performance evaluations and recommend improvements.
	Develop strong supplier relationships to ensure reliable supply and favorable terms.
	Negotiate best prices, payment terms, and delivery schedules while maintaining quality.
	Monitor and control procurement costs against budget.
	Ensure cost savings initiatives are implemented and reported.
	Ensure all procurement activities comply with company policies, NCDMB (Nigerian Content Development &amp; Monitoring Board) requirements, and other regulatory standards.
	Maintain accurate and auditable records of procurement activities, contracts, and agreements.
	Support audits and provide necessary documentation when required.
	Coordinate with logistics and warehouse teams for timely delivery of goods to rig sites, warehouses, and operational bases.
	Monitor shipments, customs clearance, and delivery timelines to prevent operational downtime.
	Resolve delivery discrepancies and claims with suppliers.
	Collaborate with drilling, engineering, HSE, and finance teams to understand procurement needs.
	Ensure critical drilling supplies and equipment are available to avoid rig downtime.
	Provide periodic procurement reports and analysis to management.


Requirements
What are we looking for?


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, Engineering, or related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in procurement/supply chain for a drilling contractor.
	Proven track record of handling procurement for drilling rigs, consumables, and services.
	Professional certification (CIPS, ISM, NIProc, or equivalent) is an advantage.


Key Skills and competencies:


	Strong knowledge of oil &amp; gas procurement processes, including drilling materials and services.
	Excellent negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
	Proficiency in MS Office Suite and ERP/procurement software (SAP/Oracle/IFS).
	Good knowledge of Nigerian Content laws, import/export regulations, and local supply market.

Procurement Officer Job at Nestoil Plc




        
    

        
        Nestoil Plc was incorporated in Nigeria in 1991 for the provision of Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) services to the energy and oil & gas industry. Since then, Nestoil has grown to become the leading indigenous EPC provider for major IOCs (International Oil Companies) in Sub-Saharan Africa like National Petroleum Company (NNPC) Shell, Exxon Mobil, Chevron, Total, etc.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer

Job Locations: Warri, Delta

Job Description
     

            
    




	The Procurement Officer will be responsible for the efficient sourcing, purchasing, and management of materials, equipment, and services required for drilling operations.
	The role ensures that procurement activities are cost-effective, timely, compliant with company policies, and aligned with local and international regulatory standards in the oil & gas industry.


Responsibilities
As a Procurement Officer, your responsibilities will be:


	Source, evaluate, and negotiate with approved vendors, suppliers, and contractors.
	Prepare and issue purchase orders (POs) in line with drilling operational needs.
	Ensure procurement of drilling consumables, spare parts, tools, equipment, and support services.
	Maintain an updated vendor database, ensuring suppliers meet quality, HSE, and compliance requirements.
	Conduct vendor performance evaluations and recommend improvements.
	Develop strong supplier relationships to ensure reliable supply and favorable terms.
	Negotiate best prices, payment terms, and delivery schedules while maintaining quality.
	Monitor and control procurement costs against budget.
	Ensure cost savings initiatives are implemented and reported.
	Ensure all procurement activities comply with company policies, NCDMB (Nigerian Content Development & Monitoring Board) requirements, and other regulatory standards.
	Maintain accurate and auditable records of procurement activities, contracts, and agreements.
	Support audits and provide necessary documentation when required.
	Coordinate with logistics and warehouse teams for timely delivery of goods to rig sites, warehouses, and operational bases.
	Monitor shipments, customs clearance, and delivery timelines to prevent operational downtime.
	Resolve delivery discrepancies and claims with suppliers.
	Collaborate with drilling, engineering, HSE, and finance teams to understand procurement needs.
	Ensure critical drilling supplies and equipment are available to avoid rig downtime.
	Provide periodic procurement reports and analysis to management.


Requirements
What are we looking for?


	Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, Engineering, or related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in procurement/supply chain for a drilling contractor.
	Proven track record of handling procurement for drilling rigs, consumables, and services.
	Professional certification (CIPS, ISM, NIProc, or equivalent) is an advantage.


Key Skills and competencies:


	Strong knowledge of oil & gas procurement processes, including drilling materials and services.
	Excellent negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
	Proficiency in MS Office Suite and ERP/procurement software (SAP/Oracle/IFS).
	Good knowledge of Nigerian Content laws, import/export regulations, and local supply market.
